entries.entry: Learned what an object is and how it's structured. Setting and accessing values using dot notation and square bracket notation.
Did many practice exercises with functions. Pure and impure functions. ChickenMonkey.

Used vanilla JS to build DOM components. Learned about rest operators. Created generic functions that can be used to construct all kinds of new DOM elements. Learned to use DOM fragments. Rest operators were harder to understand, as they didn't appear as readable.

Built a basic shopping site as a class, with a working shopping cart. Split off from the class with the goal of adding the ability to display, increment, and decrement quantity of items in the cart and adjust prices accordingly. Worked with .find() and event listeners for the first time. I got it working! (See duck-dovetail repo on github)

Tasked with building a working tic-tac-toe game. I got it working and am pleased with the result. I wrote working code then refactored it a couple times to make it dry. (See tic-tac-toe repo on github)

Built a small local .json list of foods. Fetched data from the local API, then used an outside API to gather additional data. Combined all the data to build HTML representations of the food list. First time using asynchronous programming. First intro to promises (and promises within promises). It was a lot of new info but makes sense as we talk through it in class. (See food-API repo on github)

I built a single-page application with 3 teammates to allow a user to build an itinerary for a day in Nashville. Users can search for parks, restaurants, meetups, and concerts, and save items of interest to their itinerary. I was personally responsible for the Parks portions of the project.

We queried third-party APIs using JavaScript fetch to get specific information that matched user input. We wrote functions to dynamically turn the retrieved data into DOM components for the user to see and interact with. We used event listeners to handle user events and trigger additional actions.

Installed Grunt and set it up to automate tasks, including launching http-server and json-server, and syntax checking with eslint. Learned how to set up grunt for new projects. I'm excited to have some of these repetitive tasks automated.

Practiced taking user input and turning it into objects to fetch-POST to an API. Also practiced using info in an API to dynamically populate (a drop-down menu in this case) the DOM. (See lego repo on Github)
Learned that a factory function is any function that returns a new object. Did a few practice exercises writing factory functions.
